enWisdom: The best [act of] obedience is turning away from [worldly] pleasures
The best obedience is relinquishing the [worldly] pleasures
To the extent of happiness there is trouble
To the extent of pleasure, there is distress

Wisdom: خِدْمَةُ الْجَسَدِ إِعْطَاؤُهُ مَا يَسْتَدْعِيهِ مِنَ الْمَلَاذِّ وَالشَّهَوَاتِ وَالْمُقْتَنِيَاتِ وَفِي ذَلِكَ هَلَاكُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: Serving the body is granting it whatever it seeks of pleasures and desires and what it covets, but in [all] this is the destruction of the soul

Wisdom: قَلَّ مَنْ غَرِيَ بِاللَّذَّاتِ إِلَّا كَانَ بِهَا هَلَاكُهُ
enWisdom: Few are those who are enticed by pleasures but that their destruction is caused by it
The root of [all] woes is being distracted by [worldly] pleasures
Many a pleasure has death [hidden] in it

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ عَرَفَ سُوءَ عَوَاقِبِ اللَّذَّاتِ كَيْفَ لَا يَعِفُّ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who knows the evil consequences of [forbidden] pleasures, how can he not remain chaste?!

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ لَذَّةٍ دَنِيَّةٍ مَنَعَتْ سَنِيَّ [سَنَا] دَرَجَاتٍ
enWisdom: How many a vile pleasure has prevented one from [attaining] lofty stations
The ardent desire of the soul for [forbidden] pleasures misguides and destroys

Wisdom: لَا تُوَازِي لَذَّةُ الْمَعْصِيَةِ فُضُوحَ الْآخِرَةِ وَأَلِيمَ الْعُقُوبَاتِ
enWisdom: The pleasure of disobedience does not equate to the disgrace in the Hereafter and its painful chastisements

Wisdom: لَا تَقُومُ حَلَاوَةُ اللَّذَّةِ بِمَرَارَةِ الْآفَاتِ
enWisdom: The sweetness of [worldly] pleasure does not compensate for the bitterness of adversities

Wisdom: لَا خَيْرَ فِي لَذَّةٍ تُوجِبُ نَدَماً وَشَهْوَةٍ تُعْقِبُ أَلَماً
enWisdom: There is no good in the pleasure that brings about regret and the desire that is followed by pain
